oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ambrotype of Pvt. John Boyd Brown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. John Boyd Brown of Birchwood, Hamilton County, Tenn., Co. E, 5th Tenn. Inf., USA, wore a Federal shell jacket and held a Model 1860 Colt army revolver. His belt had a "US" belt buckle with a cartridge box and cap pouch. The image was hand-tinted with gold. Birchwood was located in what briefly became James County from 1871-1919.
